Linear Models Report

Source: R/report.lm.R
report.lm.Rd

Create a report of a linear model.

# S3 method for lm
report(x, CI = 95, effsize = "cohen1988", data = NULL,
  ...)

Arguments

x

Object of class lm.
CI

Confidence Interval (CI) level. Default to 95%.
effsize

Compute standardized parameters and interpret them using a set of rules. Can be "cohen1988" (default), "sawilowsky2009", NULL, or a custom set of rules.
data

Dataframe used to fit the model. Can be useful to compute standardized parameters.
...

Arguments passed to or from other methods.

Examples

model <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length * Species, data = iris)
r <- report(model)
to_text(r)
#> We fitted a linear model to predict Sepal.Length with Petal.Length and Species. The model's explanatory power (R2) is of 0.84 (adj. R2 = 0.83). The model's intercept is at 4.21. 
#> 
#> Within this model: 
#>   - Petal.Length is not significant (beta = 0.54, 95% CI [0.00, 1.09], p = 0.05) and large (Std. beta = 1.16).
#>   - Speciesversicolor is significant (beta = -1.81, 95% CI [-2.99, -0.62], p < .01) and large (Std. beta = -0.88).
#>   - Speciesvirginica is significant (beta = -3.15, 95% CI [-4.41, -1.90], p < .001) and large (Std. beta = -1.75).
#>   - Petal.Length:Speciesversicolor is not significant (beta = 0.29, 95% CI [-0.30, 0.87], p > .1) and medium (Std. beta = 0.61).
#>   - Petal.Length:Speciesvirginica is not significant (beta = 0.45, 95% CI [-0.12, 1.03], p > .1) and large (Std. beta = 0.97).
to_fulltext(r)
#> We fitted a linear model to predict Sepal.Length with Petal.Length and Species (formula = Sepal.Length ~ Petal.Length * Species). Effect sizes were labelled following Cohen's (1988) recommendations. The model explains a significant proportion of variance (R2 = 0.84, F(6, 144) = 151.71, p < .001, adj. R2 = 0.83). The model's intercept is at 4.21(t() = 10.34, 95% CI [3.41, 5.02], p < .001). 
#> 
#> Within this model: 
#>   - Petal.Length is positive, not significant (beta = 0.54, t(144) = 1.96, 95% CI [0.00, 1.09], p = 0.05) and large (Std. beta = 1.16, Std. SE = 0.59, Std. 95% CI [-0.01, 2.32]).
#>   - Speciesversicolor is negative, significant (beta = -1.81, t(144) = -3.02, 95% CI [-2.99, -0.62], p < .01) and large (Std. beta = -0.88, Std. SE = 0.77, Std. 95% CI [-2.41, 0.65]).
#>   - Speciesvirginica is negative, significant (beta = -3.15, t(144) = -4.97, 95% CI [-4.41, -1.90], p < .001) and large (Std. beta = -1.75, Std. SE = 0.79, Std. 95% CI [-3.32, -0.18]).
#>   - Petal.Length:Speciesversicolor is positive, not significant (beta = 0.29, t(144) = 0.97, 95% CI [-0.30, 0.87], p > .1) and medium (Std. beta = 0.61, Std. SE = 0.63, Std. 95% CI [-0.63, 1.85]).
#>   - Petal.Length:Speciesvirginica is positive, not significant (beta = 0.45, t(144) = 1.56, 95% CI [-0.12, 1.03], p > .1) and large (Std. beta = 0.97, Std. SE = 0.62, Std. 95% CI [-0.26, 2.19]).
to_table(r)
#>                        Parameter       beta       CI_low    CI_high

#> 2                   Petal.Length  0.5422926 -0.004757525  1.0893427
